name: AI-Powered Vendor Policy & RSS Feed Analysis with Integrated Risk Scoring

user.name: Kamalraj
user.bio: Governance and compliance expert simplifying control frameworks with secure, AI-powered automations.

description:
## üß† Overview

A dual-engine, AI-driven **n8n** workflow that automates the monitoring of both vendor policy webpages and compliance-related RSS feeds. It intelligently detects recent updates, evaluates their potential risk, and delivers a structured HTML digest categorized by severity ‚Äî right to your inbox.

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è How It Works

1Ô∏è‚É£ **Scheduled Execution**  
‚è∞ Runs daily at 3 AM to ensure timely and consistent monitoring.

2Ô∏è‚É£ **Dual Data Streams**  
- üì∞ **RSS Feed Monitoring**: Ingests articles from selected feeds focused on security, privacy, and compliance.  
- üåê **Vendor Webpage Monitoring**: Fetches specified policy URLs and checks for updates using `Last-Modified` headers and in-page content analysis.

3Ô∏è‚É£ **Content Filtering**  
üßπ Applies logic to filter out stale or irrelevant data, focusing only on updates within the past 24 hours.

4Ô∏è‚É£ **AI-Powered Risk Categorization**  
ü§ñ Two dedicated AI agents (one per stream) analyze content to:  
- üìù Generate a 2-line compliance/risk-focused summary  
- üö¶ Assign a risk score: **High**, **Medium**, **Low**, or **Informational**

5Ô∏è‚É£ **Digest Generation**  
üñºÔ∏è Summaries are grouped by risk level and formatted into a visually polished HTML report, using category-specific styles and color coding.

6Ô∏è‚É£ **Email Delivery**  
üìß Automatically sends out two separate email reports via Gmail:  
- üóÇÔ∏è One for vendor **webpage updates**  
- üì∞ One for **RSS feed-based** vendor news

---

## ‚ú® Key Features

- üîÅ **Automates daily monitoring** across feeds and policy pages  
- ü§ñ **AI-driven summarization** and structured risk scoring  
- üßæ **Clean, HTML-formatted digests** grouped by risk category  
- üß© **Fully customizable**: feed sources, vendor URLs, AI prompts, and email styling  
- üõ°Ô∏è **Designed for compliance, security, and risk teams** needing proactive intelligence

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).

workflow.name: AI-Powered Vendor Policy & Feed Analysis with Integrated Risk Scoring

nodes.name: HTTP Request
nodes.notes: üåê Requests vendor policy pages for content inspection.

nodes.name: AI Agent
nodes.notes: ü§ñ Analyzes grouped RSS feeds and categorizes risks using structured JSON.

options.systemMessage:
=Vendor Risk & Compliance Digest Prompt

AI Agent Role: You are a Senior Compliance & Risk Intelligence Analyst embedded in an automation workflow. Your job is to analyze compliance-related content from vendor feeds and produce structured, actionable summaries for use by compliance, security, and executive teams. Dont Halucinate, Dont add any new news, only act on the provided data

üßæ Input Format

You will receive a single JSON object containing an array of items. Each item is structured as:

{
  "Title": "...",
  "Vendor Name": "...",
  "link": "https://‚Ä¶",
  "content": "Snippet or article content here"
}

üß† Instructions

Deduplicate entries by the link field.

For each unique item:

Assign a Risk Rating:

High

Medium

Low

Informational

Write a 2-sentence summary from a compliance, risk, or security standpoint.

Group the output by the risk level in a single JSON object.

Omit any empty groups (i.e., risk levels with no entries).

Do not include extra prose, HTML, Markdown, or escape characters.

‚úÖ Output Format

Respond with only this structure:

{
  "High": [
    { "summary": "...", "link": "https://...", "Title": "...","Vendor Name": "..." }
  ],
  "Medium": [ ... ],
  "Low": [ ... ],
  "Informational": [ ... ]
}

This output will be used by downstream code to generate an HTML email digest.

nodes.name: AI Agent1

nodes.name: Gmail
nodes.notes: üì® Sends summary email for webpage policy updates.

nodes.notes: üìß Sends HTML newsletter summary email for RSS feeds.

nodes.name: Filtering last 24hrs feed
nodes.notes: ‚è≥ Filters RSS articles published in the last 24 hours.

nodes.name: Formatting the Content for Mail
nodes.notes: üíå Formats AI response as styled HTML grouped by risk category.

nodes.name: Sort the feeds
nodes.notes: üîÉ Sort the RSS entries by pubDate for consistent order.

nodes.name: Merge the content for AI
nodes.notes: üß© Merges cleaned RSS entries into one payload for the AI agent.

nodes.name: Merge
nodes.notes: üîÄ Merge both page meta and body-based content analysis.

nodes.name: Format the Summary for Email
nodes.notes: üßæ Formats webpage summary output into email-ready HTML.

nodes.name: Scrapping inside the Webpage content
nodes.notes: üîç Inspects webpage HTML body to find 'update/modified' dates.

nodes.name: Cleaning up the code
nodes.notes: üßπ Cleans and strips raw HTML into readable content for AI processing.

nodes.name: Daily Trigger
nodes.notes: ‚è∞ Triggers the workflow every day at 3 AM to initiate all newsletter jobs.

nodes.name: Splitting the Urls
nodes.notes: üîÄ Split array of vendor URLs to process them individually.

nodes.notes: üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Checks vendor page headers for signs of recent updates (last modified).

parameters.content:
## üõ°Ô∏è AI-Powered Vendor Policy & RSS Feed Analysis with Integrated Risk Scoring

This workflow automates monitoring, analyzing, and scoring vendor-related updates using RSS feeds and direct web scraping. It leverages AI agents to produce actionable, risk-categorized summaries delivered via email in a clean, styled HTML format.

### üöÄ Features
- üì• **Pulls updates** from RSS feeds and vendor policy pages  
- ü§ñ **Uses AI agents** to analyze and assign risk ratings (High, Medium, Low, Informational)  
- üßπ **Extracts and cleans** web content for LLM processing  
- üïµÔ∏è **Filters changes** within last 24 hours using headers, body text, and AI-based date detection  
- üíå **Sends separate HTML email digests** for RSS and webpage-based insights  

### üß± Workflow Modules

#### üì° RSS Feed Monitoring
- üîó Reads vendor feed URLs  
- ‚è≥ Filters posts from the last 24 hours  
- üß† Sends entries to AI agent for risk assessment and summarization  

#### üåê Webpage Monitoring
- üîç Scrapes vendor policy URLs  
- üìÖ Extracts update dates using:
  - üßæ *Last-Modified headers*
  - üß† *HTML body scan* for keywords like ‚Äúupdated‚Äù or ‚Äúmodified‚Äù
- ‚úçÔ∏è Uses AI to extract, summarize, and categorize risk content  

#### üßæ Output
- üóÇÔ∏è Formats summaries by risk level  
- üìß Sends HTML digest emails to designated recipients  

---

### üß™ Use Case Scenarios

#### ‚úÖ Use Case 1: RSS Feed-Based Risk Categorization

**Scenario:**  
Your organization subscribes to cybersecurity and compliance blogs like TechCrunch or Smashing Magazine. You want to identify which new updates might indicate High or Medium vendor risk.

**Workflow Behavior:**
- üóûÔ∏è Filters feed articles from the last 24 hours  
- üß† AI assigns risk level and summarizes content  
- üì¨ Email shows grouped insights (üî¥ High, üü† Medium, etc.)

**Example Output:**

üî¥ **High Risk**  
**Vendor:** Vendor name  
**Title:** ‚ÄúZero-Day Vulnerability in XYZ‚Äù  
**Summary:** A critical zero-day was reported affecting vendor systems. Immediate patching is required.  
üëâ *Read more*

---

#### ‚úÖ Use Case 2: Vendor Policy Page Monitoring

**Scenario:**  
You need to track privacy or terms-of-service pages for subtle but important changes.

**Workflow Behavior:**
- üåê Scrapes specified vendor URLs (e.g., Privacy Policy)  
- üìÖ Extracts ‚ÄúLast Modified‚Äù date or infers updates via HTML content  
- ü§ñ AI summarizes the change and assesses risk  

**Example Output:**

üü† **Medium Risk**  
**Vendor:** Vendor name  
**Title:** ‚ÄúPrivacy Policy Updated‚Äù  
**Summary:** The vendor added new clauses around third-party data sharing. Legal review recommended.  
üëâ *Read more*
